name: Remy Russell
seeking: Currently seeking remote or hybrid roles in the Salt Lake City area.
summary: An optimistic and technical product leader with three years of Product Management and seven years of Business Analysis experience evolving SaaS platforms for Health and Human Services Providers.

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Platform and Integrations R&D team/pod for a configurable Case Management platform (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, etc.)
highlights: Helped drive growth in ARR by over 50% to ~$15M by expanding platform capabilities and enabling the Sales team, leading to acquisition
Shipped a new RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded external developers for over ten customer organizations, iterating/improving the capabilities and processes with each experience

Evolved product lines based on business priorities and insights, frequently releasing new features/enhancements (SSO & 2-Step Verification, scheduled CSV exports, no-code form designer and API tools, etc.)
Partnered with Engineering, Sales, Leadership, and others to maintain the roadmap, define KPIs, measure/communicate progress, and improve processes for scalability
Delivered and scrapped POCs/MVPs for new features and integrations (secure messaging with clients, SMS/email notifications via Twilio, last-mile delivery operations via Onfleet, etc.)
Implemented microservices for Health Information Exchange and Revenue Cycle Managment integration use cases (following HL7 and X12 EDI standards)

professionalExperience.description: Problem discovery, requirements gathering, and solutioning with new customers to guide new implementations on the case management platform.
highlights: Drove the successful implementation for two of Eccovia's top ten largest customers by ARR, including complex data migrations and integrations
Took ownership of all new integration contracts across new customers (over a dozen) and helped transition our technical strategy towards agnostic services to support multiple customers and partners

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, UT MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: System migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a new Medicaid Management Information System for the Utah Department of Health
highlights: Collaborated with the State customer and internal engineers to design and document the Provider Enrollment Subsystem to guide development and testing

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst, MI MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services and iterated the solution for the 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program'

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015

coreSkills: Problem/solution discovery, learning from users/buyers, and owning complex challenges
Stakeholder communication and ability to articulate technical details or high-level strategy
Managing competing priorities and making data-driven decisions
Facilitating cross-functional collaboration and rapid, iterative delivery of value
Quickly learning and embracing new tools, processes, and methodologies
Partnering and communicating with Engineers (SQL proficient, basic understanding of SDLC concepts, experience evaluating APIs & technical documentation)
toolsAndFrameworks: Insight collection/consolidation (MS Forms, Glean, Hubspot, ProductBoard, SQL)
Workshopping, Diagramming, & Brainstorming (Confluence Whiteboards, Lucidchart, AI tools)
Mock-ups and low-fi prototyping for UX research (Figma, AI Tools)
GTM and release communication (Jira, Azure Pipelines, ReleaseNotes.io for automated user/subscriber notifications)
No or low-code API Testing and workflow automation (Zapier, Microsoft Power Automate, Postman)
Dual-track Agile, Scrum (Jira for roadmapping, backlog refinement, Kanban workflows, sprint ceremonies, etc.)
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, or hiking/camping with my dogs
Podcasts/audiobooks on anything related to science, technology, or health
